title: Macron's failed bet to achieve full employment by 2027
subhead: The French president set a goal of reducing the unemployment rate to 5% by the end of his second term. That target has become unattainable according to figures from the national statistics office published on Tuesday, which show a 0.6-point increase over the past year, reaching 7.9%.

title: Macron visits Dunkirk and champions a revival of the industrial sector
Israel takes new step in West Bank settlement expansion
Jacques Leveugle, the serial sexual predator accused of abusing at least 89 minors
subhead: The 79-year-old has been charged with dozens of rapes and sexual assaults committed against teenagers aged 13 to 17 in nine countries. On February 10, Grenoble prosecutor Etienne Manteaux launched a public appeal for witnesses in order to identify other possible victims.

title: At least 10 dead, including suspected gunman, after shooting at a school and residence in Canada
subhead: Police said an alert was issued about an active shooter at Tumbler Ridge Secondary School on Tuesday afternoon. The person believed to be responsible for the killings was found deceased with what appears to be a self-inflicted injury, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police said.

title: 'Heated rivalry' already has fans in France: 'It's frustrating to see the series reduced to just a sex story'
subhead: Barely released on HBO Max, the Canadian production depicting the love story between two hockey players is already generating excitement in France. Fans gathered at a Paris bookstore explained their interest in the relationship between the main characters, beyond the erotic scenes.

title: The dance against the clock of skaters Guillaume Cizeron and Laurence Fournier Beaudry
subhead: The French duo is in the lead going into the free dance finale in Milan on Wednesday. The improbable accomplishment of a gold medal is within reach for a partnership that only formed one drama-filled year ago.

Emmanuel Macron: 'Now is the time for the EU to launch a joint borrowing capacity, through eurobonds'
subhead: Two days ahead of a meeting of European Union heads of state and government in Brussels, the French president calls on the 27 member states, in an interview with Le Monde and several other European newspapers, to make joint investments in protecting the environment, as well as in artificial intelligence and quantum technology, to avoid falling behind.

title: The international drug trafficker who operated right next to the Elysée Palace
subhead: Firat Cinko faces life imprisonment for allegedly orchestrating international cocaine trafficking between Venezuela, Martinique and France aboard a Smart car parked near the presidential palace in Paris.
byline: Abdelhak El Idrissi and  Guillaume Daudin

title: Mayor and mother: The young women changing France's local councils
subhead: Only 41 women under the age of 30 were elected as mayors in 2020, out of France's 34,885 mayors. Here are the stories of several women who have balanced their careers, motherhood and first terms in office in a political scene often dominated by older men.
